intro: Casearia lindeniana, commonly known as the yellow casearina, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, yellow flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its fruits are small, capsule-like structures that contain several seeds. Casearia lindeniana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
